description: Change of use of basement and ground floor of commercial premises (Use Class A1) to tuition centre for children (Use Class D1)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): SMR18-01 (Site Location Plan) and SMR18-02B (Existing and Proposed Plans).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the provision of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) the use of the ground floor of the building hereby permitted shall only be used for the purpose of a D1c, tuition centre, and for no other purpose whatsoever and shall at all times maintain an active and open shop frontage with visibility to and from the premises and the street.

Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain control over any future use of the premises in the interests of the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and to ensure adequate parking and servicing is available for alternative uses within the Ealing Secondary Shopping Frontage andEaling Green Conservation Area. | Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, the shop frontage shall at all times be clear glazed between 1m from external ground level to 2m from external ground level without blinds, curtains, railings, shutters, posters or any other such feature that might obscure the clear glazing so that clear visibility from the public highway through the shop will be maintained for at least 50% of the clear glazing which shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To maintain an active shopping frontage to the high street for its vitality and vibrancy | Three Sheffield stands for cycle parking shall be provided to the rear of the shop unit prior to occupation of the site and thereafter retained for the lifetime of the premises.
Reason: To ensure satisfactory facilities for cyclists and to support sustainable modes of transport | Opening hours can take place between 07.00 -11pm Monday to Sunday

Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain control over any future use of the premises in the interests of the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and to ensure adequate parking and servicing is available for alternative uses within the Ealing Secondary Shopping Frontage and wider locality | A Green Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior first occupation. The details submitted shall be designed to manage the transport needs of the staff, pupils, parents and visitors to the tuition centre, in order to demonstrate a car restraint policy for the site, minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport. This should include a drop off strategy for those travelling to the site by car. The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of the development and shall be retained for the life of the development.

REASON: To promote the use of modes of transport, other than use of private motor vehicles, in pursuance of the Council's policies on sustainability in accordance with Policy 6.1 of the London Plan (2016) and Policy 1.1 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012).

| No amplified music or speech shall be played at any time within the development hereby approved outside the hours of operation hereby allowed and at no time in the external areas of the development.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby residential properties and commercial premises, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
